By Fact 5, there exist ∈𝒜absent𝒜{\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}∈ caligraphic_A such that :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H and

x=u,y=v.formulae-sequence𝑥𝑢𝑦𝑣{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x=u,\quad{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y=v.italic_x = italic_u , italic_y = italic_v .

We conclude

zA⁢zBsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵\displaystyle z_{A}z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈∥x−y∥∥x−y∥exp[±i∠(x−y,x−y))]\displaystyle\in\frac{\lVert{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y\rVert}{% \lVert x-y\rVert}\exp[\pm i\angle({\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y,x-y))]∈ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ ± italic_i ∠ ( italic_x - italic_y , italic_x - italic_y ) ) ]
⊆𝒢⁢().absent𝒢\displaystyle\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}({\varbbA}{\varbbB}).⊆ caligraphic_G ( ) .

Next, we show 𝒢⁢(𝒜)⊆𝒢⁢(𝒜)⁢𝒢⁢()𝒢𝒜𝒢𝒜𝒢{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}{\varbbB}\right)\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( ). Consider any :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H satisfying ∈𝒜absent𝒜{\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}∈ caligraphic_A. We will show 𝒢⁢()⊆𝒢⁢(𝒜)⁢𝒢⁢()𝒢𝒢𝒜𝒢{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}\right)\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)caligraphic_G ( ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( ), and, by (2), this is equivalent to

𝒢(/)x,y⊆𝒢(𝒜)𝒢(){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}% \left({\mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)caligraphic_G ( / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( )

for all distinct x,y∈dom𝑥𝑦domx,y\in\mathrm{dom}\,{\varbbA}{\varbbB}italic_x , italic_y ∈ roman_dom.

Let x,y∈dom𝑥𝑦domx,y\in\mathrm{dom}\,{\varbbA}{\varbbB}italic_x , italic_y ∈ roman_dom be distinct. If x=y𝑥𝑦{\varbbB}x={\varbbB}yitalic_x = italic_y, then 0∈𝒢⁢()0𝒢0\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)0 ∈ caligraphic_G ( ) and x=y𝑥𝑦{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x={\varbbA}{\varbbB}yitalic_x = italic_y. Thus,

𝒢(/)x,y={0}⊆𝒢(𝒜)𝒢().{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)=\{0\}\subseteq{\mathcal{% G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right).caligraphic_G ( / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = { 0 } ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( ) .

Next, consider the case x≠y𝑥𝑦{\varbbB}x\neq{\varbbB}yitalic_x ≠ italic_y. Define

zA⁢B=∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢exp⁡[i⁢∠⁢(x−y,x−y)]subscript𝑧𝐴𝐵delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦𝑖∠𝑥𝑦𝑥𝑦z_{AB}=\frac{\lVert{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y\rVert}{\lVert x-y% \rVert}\exp[i\angle({\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y,x-y)]italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ italic_i ∠ ( italic_x - italic_y , italic_x - italic_y ) ]

so that 𝒢(/)x,y={zA⁢B,{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)=\{z_{AB},caligraphic_G ( / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = { italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,. Furthermore, we write

φBsubscript𝜑𝐵\displaystyle\varphi_{B}italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =∠⁢(x−y,x−y),absent∠𝑥𝑦𝑥𝑦\displaystyle=\angle({\varbbB}x-{\varbbB}y,x-y),= ∠ ( italic_x - italic_y , italic_x - italic_y ) ,
φA⁢B/Bsubscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵\displaystyle\varphi_{AB/B}italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =∠⁢(x−y,x−y),absent∠𝑥𝑦𝑥𝑦\displaystyle=\angle({\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y,{\varbbB}x-{% \varbbB}y),= ∠ ( italic_x - italic_y , italic_x - italic_y ) ,
zBsubscript𝑧𝐵\displaystyle z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢exp⁡[i⁢φB],absentdelimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦𝑖subscript𝜑𝐵\displaystyle=\frac{\lVert{\varbbB}x-{\varbbB}y\rVert}{\lVert x-y\rVert}\exp[i% \varphi_{B}],= divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ italic_i italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ,
zA⁢B/Bsubscript𝑧𝐴𝐵𝐵\displaystyle z_{AB/B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢exp⁡[i⁢φA⁢B/B].absentdelimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦𝑖subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵\displaystyle=\frac{\lVert{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y\rVert}{% \lVert{\varbbB}x-{\varbbB}y\rVert}\exp[i\varphi_{AB/B}].= divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ italic_i italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .

Observe that zBsubscript𝑧𝐵z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and zA⁢B/B∈𝒢⁢()⊆𝒢⁢(𝒜)subscript𝑧𝐴𝐵𝐵𝒢𝒢𝒜z_{AB/B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}\right)\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ).

First, suppose 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A has the right-arc property. By Fact 1,

∠⁢(x−y,x−y)∈[|φB−φA⁢B/B|,φB+φA⁢B/B].∠𝑥𝑦𝑥𝑦subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵\angle\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y,x-y\right)\in\left[\lvert% \varphi_{B}-\varphi_{AB/B}\rvert,\varphi_{B}+\varphi_{AB/B}\right].∠ ( italic_x - italic_y , italic_x - italic_y ) ∈ [ | italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | , italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .

Therefore,

zA⁢Bsubscript𝑧𝐴𝐵\displaystyle z_{AB}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢exp⁡[i⁢[|φB−φA⁢B/B|,φB+φA⁢B/B]]absentdelimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦𝑖subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵\displaystyle\in\frac{\lVert{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y\rVert}{% \lVert x-y\rVert}\exp\left[{i\left[|\varphi_{B}-\varphi_{AB/B}|,\varphi_{B}+% \varphi_{AB/B}\right]}\right]∈ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ italic_i [ | italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | , italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ]

⊆∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢∥x−y∥∥x−y∥⁢exp⁡[i⁢[φB−φA⁢B/B,φB+φA⁢B/B]]absentdelimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦delimited-∥∥𝑥𝑦𝑖subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵subscript𝜑𝐵subscript𝜑𝐴𝐵𝐵\displaystyle\subseteq\frac{\lVert{\varbbB}x-{\varbbB}y\rVert}{\lVert x-y% \rVert}\frac{\lVert{\varbbA}{\varbbB}x-{\varbbA}{\varbbB}y\rVert}{\lVert{% \varbbB}x-{\varbbB}y\rVert}\exp\left[i\left[\varphi_{B}-\varphi_{AB/B},\varphi% _{B}+\varphi_{AB/B}\right]\right]⊆ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG roman_exp [ italic_i [ italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B / italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ]

⊆𝒢⁢()⁢𝒢⁢(𝒜)absent𝒢𝒢𝒜\displaystyle\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right)⊆ caligraphic_G ( ) caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A )

by the right-arc property of 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A. Furthermore,

∈\displaystyle\in∈

⊆𝒢⁢()⁢𝒢⁢(𝒜).absent𝒢𝒢𝒜\displaystyle\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right).⊆ caligraphic_G ( ) caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) .

Thus, 𝒢(/)x,y={zA⁢B,{\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)=\{z_{AB},caligraphic_G ( / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = { italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,.

If 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A has the left-arc property, −𝒜𝒜-{\mathcal{A}}- caligraphic_A has the right-arc property. As −∈−𝒜-{\varbbA}\in-{\mathcal{A}}- ∈ - caligraphic_A,

𝒢(/)x,y=−𝒢(−/)x,y⊆−𝒢(−𝒜)𝒢()=𝒢(𝒜)𝒢(){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)=-{\mathcal{G}}\left(-{% \varbbA}{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}\right)\subseteq-{\mathcal{G}}\left(-{\mathcal{A}}% \right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}% \right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)caligraphic_G ( / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = - caligraphic_G ( - / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ⊆ - caligraphic_G ( - caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( ) = caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( )

by Fact 4. Therefore, by (2), we conclude 𝒢⁢(𝒜)⊆𝒢⁢(𝒜)⁢𝒢⁢()𝒢𝒜𝒢𝒜𝒢{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}{\varbbB}\right)\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({% \mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbB}\right)caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( ) when 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A has an arc property.

Corollary 2.12.

Let 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A and ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be as in Theorem 2.10. Let :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be single-valued operators. For x≠y𝑥𝑦{\varbbC}x\neq{\varbbC}yitalic_x ≠ italic_y,

⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜𝒢⁢(x,y)=𝒢⁢(𝒜x,y)=𝒢⁢(𝒜)⁢𝒢⁢(x,y)subscript:absent⇉ℋℋabsent𝒜𝒢absent𝑥𝑦𝒢𝒜𝑥𝑦𝒢𝒜𝒢absent𝑥𝑦\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{% \mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}\end{subarray}}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{\varbbA}{% \varbbB}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{\mathcal{A}}{\varbbB}}{{}% _{x,y}}\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac% {{\varbbB}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) = caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG caligraphic_A end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) = caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG )

holds.

Proof 2.13.

The first identity holds by definition, and the second identity follows from Theorem 2.10 with replacing in the theorem statement to /x,y{\varbbB}/{}_{x,y}/ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT.

2.3 Proof of Theorem 2.1

We have one final preliminary lemma to establish. The proof of Theorem 2.1 primarily focuses on operators on ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H such that dimℋ≥2dimensionℋ2\dim{\mathcal{H}}\geq 2roman_dim caligraphic_H ≥ 2 (including the case dimℋ=∞dimensionℋ\dim{\mathcal{H}}=\inftyroman_dim caligraphic_H = ∞). The following lemma allows to contain the case dimℋ=1dimensionℋ1\dim{\mathcal{H}}=1roman_dim caligraphic_H = 1.

Lemma 2.14.

Let 𝒜,ℬ,𝒞𝒜ℬ𝒞{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}}caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C be SRG-full classes and α,λ∈(0,∞)𝛼𝜆0\alpha,\lambda\in(0,\infty)italic_α , italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ). Let ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be a real Hilbert space. Then,

⋃,,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈ℬ,∈𝒞𝒢(),,,α,λ⊆⋃,′,′:′ℋ×ℋ⇉ℋ×ℋ∈′𝒜,∈′ℬ,∈′𝒞𝒢(),′,′,′α,λ.\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}% \rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{% C}}\end{subarray}}{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},\alpha,% \lambda}\right)\subseteq\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{}^{\prime},{}^{\prime},{}% ^{\prime}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\times{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}% \times{\mathcal{H}}\\ {}^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{}^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{}^{\prime}\in{% \mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{}^{\prime},{}^{\prime},{}^{% \prime},\alpha,\lambda}\right).⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_B , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ⊆ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT : caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_B , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT , start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) .

To clarify, ℋ×ℋℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}\times{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H is a real Hilbert space with dim(ℋ×ℋ)=2⁢dimℋdimensionℋℋ2dimensionℋ\dim({\mathcal{H}}\times{\mathcal{H}})=2\dim{\mathcal{H}}roman_dim ( caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H ) = 2 roman_dim caligraphic_H.

Proof 2.15.

For an operator :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H, define the embedding ıitalic-ı\imathitalic_ı as

ı⁢()italic-ı\displaystyle\imath({\varbbA})italic_ı ( ) :ℋ×ℋ⇉ℋ×ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋℋℋ\displaystyle\colon{\mathcal{H}}\times{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{% H}}\times{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H
ı⁢()italic-ı\displaystyle\imath({\varbbA})italic_ı ( ) ={((x,0),(u,0))|(x,u)∈},\displaystyle=\left\{\left((x,0),(u,0)\right)\,|\,(x,u)\in{\varbbA}\right\},= { ( ( italic_x , 0 ) , ( italic_u , 0 ) ) | ( italic_x , italic_u ) ∈ } ,

where 0∈ℋ0ℋ0\in{\mathcal{H}}0 ∈ caligraphic_H. Intuitively speaking, ı⁢()italic-ı\imath({\varbbA})italic_ı ( ) is essentially the same operator as , with graph⁢()⊆ℋ×ℋgraphℋℋ\mathrm{graph}({\varbbA})\subseteq{\mathcal{H}}\times{\mathcal{H}}roman_graph ( ) ⊆ caligraphic_H × caligraphic_H embedded into (ℋ×{0})×(ℋ×{0})ℋ0ℋ0({\mathcal{H}}\times\{0\})\times({\mathcal{H}}\times\{0\})( caligraphic_H × { 0 } ) × ( caligraphic_H × { 0 } ). One can observe that

ı⁢(+)=ı⁢()+ı⁢(),ı⁢()=ı⁢()⁢ı⁢(),formulae-sequenceitalic-ıitalic-ıitalic-ıitalic-ıitalic-ıitalic-ı\displaystyle\imath({\varbbA}+{\varbbB})=\imath({\varbbA})+\imath({\varbbB}),% \quad\imath({\varbbA}{\varbbB})=\imath({\varbbA})\imath({\varbbB}),italic_ı ( + ) = italic_ı ( ) + italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) = italic_ı ( ) italic_ı ( ) ,
ı(α)=αı(),ı(+)=+ı(),ı()−1=ı()−1,\displaystyle\imath(\alpha{\varbbA})=\alpha\imath({\varbbA}),\quad\imath({% \varbbI}+{\varbbA})={\varbbI}+\imath({\varbbA}),\quad\imath({}^{-1})=\imath({% \varbbA})^{-1},italic_ı ( italic_α ) = italic_α italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( + ) = + italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_ı ( ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
ı()α=,α⁢ı⁢()ı(),,,α,λ=.ı⁢(),ı⁢(),ı⁢(),α,λ\displaystyle\imath({}_{\alpha{\varbbA}})={}_{\alpha\imath({\varbbA})},\quad% \imath({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},\alpha,\lambda})={}_{\imath({\varbbA}% ),\imath({\varbbB}),\imath({\varbbC}),\alpha,\lambda}.italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT .

We omit the proof of the first five statements for conciseness, which can be done by a simple algebra. The last two expressions are consequences of the former statements. In particular, observe that

ı()α=ı((+α)−1)=ı(+α)−1=(+αı())−1=,α⁢ı⁢()\imath({}_{\alpha{\varbbA}})=\imath(({\varbbI}+\alpha{\varbbA})^{-1})=\imath({% \varbbI}+\alpha{\varbbA})^{-1}=({\varbbI}+\alpha\imath({\varbbA}))^{-1}={}_{% \alpha\imath({\varbbA})},italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_ı ( ( + italic_α ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_ı ( + italic_α ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( + italic_α italic_ı ( ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ,

and

ı(),,,α,λ\displaystyle\imath({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},\alpha,\lambda})italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) =ı(−λ+αλ(2−α−α)αα)\displaystyle=\imath({\varbbI}-\lambda{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+\lambda{}_{\alpha{% \varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}))= italic_ı ( - italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) )
=−λı()α+λı()α(2ı()α−−αı()ı()α)\displaystyle={\varbbI}-\lambda\imath({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})+\lambda\imath({}_{% \alpha{\varbbA}})(2\imath({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})-{\varbbI}-\alpha\imath({% \varbbC})\imath({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}))= - italic_λ italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_λ italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - - italic_α italic_ı ( ) italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) )
=−λ+α⁢ı⁢()λ(2−α⁢ı⁢()−αı())α⁢ı⁢()α⁢ı⁢()\displaystyle={\varbbI}-\lambda{}_{\alpha\imath({\varbbB})}+\lambda{}_{\alpha% \imath({\varbbA})}(2{}_{\alpha\imath({\varbbB})}-{\varbbI}-\alpha\imath({% \varbbC}){}_{\alpha\imath({\varbbB})})= - italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α italic_ı ( ) start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_ı ( ) end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT )
=.ı⁢(),ı⁢(),ı⁢(),α,λ\displaystyle={}_{\imath({\varbbA}),\imath({\varbbB}),\imath({\varbbC}),\alpha% ,\lambda}.= start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT .

Furthermore, if ∈𝒜absent𝒜{\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}∈ caligraphic_A, then

𝒢⁢(ı⁢())=𝒢⁢()⊆𝒢⁢(𝒜).𝒢italic-ı𝒢𝒢𝒜{\mathcal{G}}\left(\imath({\varbbA})\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left({\varbbA}\right% )\subseteq{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{A}}\right).caligraphic_G ( italic_ı ( ) ) = caligraphic_G ( ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_A ) .

Therefore, if 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A is an SRG-full class, then

∈𝒜⇒ı⁢()∈𝒜.formulae-sequenceabsent𝒜⇒italic-ı𝒜{\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}\quad\Rightarrow\quad\imath({\varbbA})\in{\mathcal{A}}.∈ caligraphic_A ⇒ italic_ı ( ) ∈ caligraphic_A .

The same argument holds for ℬℬ{\mathcal{B}}caligraphic_B and 𝒞𝒞{\mathcal{C}}caligraphic_C as well. Therefore, if ∈𝒜absent𝒜{\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}∈ caligraphic_A, ∈ℬabsentℬ{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}}∈ caligraphic_B, and ∈𝒞absent𝒞{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}∈ caligraphic_C,

𝒢(),,,α,λ=𝒢(ı(),,,α,λ)=𝒢()ı⁢(),ı⁢(),ı⁢(),α,λ\displaystyle{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},\alpha,% \lambda}\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left(\imath({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda})\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\imath({\varbbA}),\imath({% \varbbB}),\imath({\varbbC}),\alpha,\lambda}\right)caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = caligraphic_G ( italic_ı ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ) = caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_ı ( ) , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT )

and ı⁢()∈𝒜italic-ı𝒜\imath({\varbbA})\in{\mathcal{A}}italic_ı ( ) ∈ caligraphic_A, ı⁢()∈ℬitalic-ıℬ\imath({\varbbB})\in{\mathcal{B}}italic_ı ( ) ∈ caligraphic_B, and ı⁢()∈𝒞italic-ı𝒞\imath({\varbbC})\in{\mathcal{C}}italic_ı ( ) ∈ caligraphic_C, which concludes the proof.

Proof 2.16 (Proof to Theorem 2.1).

Recall that our goal is to show

|𝒢()𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λ−s|=|𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−s|\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,% \lambda}\right)-s\rvert=\left|{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{% \mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}-s\right|| caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s | = | caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s |

given that 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A and ℬℬ{\mathcal{B}}caligraphic_B are SRG-full classes of monotone operators, +α⁢𝒜𝛼𝒜{\varbbI}+\alpha{\mathcal{A}}+ italic_α caligraphic_A has the right-arc property, and 𝒞𝒞{\mathcal{C}}caligraphic_C is an SRG-full class of single-valued operators such that (2−λ⁢(1−s)−1)−α⁢𝒞2𝜆superscript1𝑠1𝛼𝒞(2-\lambda(1-s)^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{C}}( 2 - italic_λ ( 1 - italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α caligraphic_C has an arc property.

Then,

|𝒢()𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λ−s|\displaystyle\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{% \mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}\right)-s\rvert| caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s | =(a)⋃ℋ:Hilbertspace⋃,,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈ℬ,∈𝒞|𝒢(),,,α,λ−s|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(a)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{{\mathcal{H}}:% \begin{subarray}{c}\mathrm{Hilbert}\\ \mathrm{space}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{% \varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{% C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda}\right)-s\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (a) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H : start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL roman_Hilbert end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_space end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_B , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s |
=(b)⋃ℋ:Hilbertspacedimℋ≥2⋃,,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈ℬ,∈𝒞|𝒢(),,,α,λ−s|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(b)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{{\mathcal{H}}:% \begin{subarray}{c}\mathrm{Hilbert}\\ \mathrm{space}\\ \dim{\mathcal{H}}\geq 2\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{% \varbbB},{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{% C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda}\right)-s\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (b) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H : start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL roman_Hilbert end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_space end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_dim caligraphic_H ≥ 2 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_B , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s |
=(c)⋃ℋ:Hilbertspacedimℋ≥2⋃x,y∈ℋx≠y⋃,,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈ℬ,∈𝒞|𝒢(/,,,α,λ)x,y−s|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(c)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{{\mathcal{H}}:% \begin{subarray}{c}\mathrm{Hilbert}\\ \mathrm{space}\\ \dim{\mathcal{H}}\geq 2\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}x,y\in{% \mathcal{H}}\\ x\neq y\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC% }\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{% C}}\end{subarray}}\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda}/{}_{x,y}\right)-s\rvertstart_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (c) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H : start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL roman_Hilbert end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_space end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_dim caligraphic_H ≥ 2 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_x , italic_y ∈ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_x ≠ italic_y end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_B , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s |
=(d)⋃ℋ:Hilbertspacedimℋ≥2⋃x,y∈ℋx≠y|𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−s|superscript(d)absentsubscript:ℋHilbertspacedimensionℋ2subscript𝑥𝑦ℋ𝑥𝑦subscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆𝑠\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(d)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{{\mathcal{H}}:% \begin{subarray}{c}\mathrm{Hilbert}\\ \mathrm{space}\\ \dim{\mathcal{H}}\geq 2\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}x,y\in{% \mathcal{H}}\\ x\neq y\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{% \mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}-s\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (d) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H : start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL roman_Hilbert end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_space end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_dim caligraphic_H ≥ 2 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_x , italic_y ∈ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_x ≠ italic_y end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s |
=(e)|𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−s|,superscript(e)absentsubscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆𝑠\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(e)}}}{{=}}\left|{\mathcal{Z}}^{% \text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}-s\right|,start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (e) end_ARG end_RELOP | caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s | ,

where (a) follows from definition of A,B,C,α,λ, (b) follows from Lemma 2.14, (c) follows from (2), (d) will be established soon, and (e) follows from the fact that |𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−s|subscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆𝑠\lvert{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},% \alpha,\lambda}-s\rvert| caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s | has no dependency on the bound union variables ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H, x𝑥xitalic_x, and y𝑦yitalic_y. We establish (d) by showing

⋃,,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈ℬ,∈𝒞|𝒢(/,,,α,λ)x,y−s|=|𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−s|\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}% \rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{% C}}\end{subarray}}\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda}/{}_{x,y}\right)-s\rvert=\left|{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{% \mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}-s\right|⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_B , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_s | = | caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s |

for any Hilbert space ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H such that dimℋ≥2dimensionℋ2\dim{\mathcal{H}}\geq 2roman_dim caligraphic_H ≥ 2 and distinct x,y∈ℋ𝑥𝑦ℋx,y\in{\mathcal{H}}italic_x , italic_y ∈ caligraphic_H.

Now, let s=1−λ⁢t𝑠1𝜆𝑡s=1-\lambda titalic_s = 1 - italic_λ italic_t. Note that s≠1𝑠1s\neq 1italic_s ≠ 1 implies t≠0𝑡0t\neq 0italic_t ≠ 0 and we have assumed that (2−t−1)−α⁢𝒞2superscript𝑡1𝛼𝒞(2-t^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{C}}( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α caligraphic_C has an arc property. The assumption that +α⁢𝒜𝛼𝒜{\varbbI}+\alpha{\mathcal{A}}+ italic_α caligraphic_A has the right-arc property implies that αA has the right-arc property: If +α⁢𝒜𝛼𝒜{\varbbI}+\alpha{\mathcal{A}}+ italic_α caligraphic_A satisfies the right-arc property and z−1∈𝒢()α⁢𝒜z^{-1}\in{\mathcal{G}}({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}})italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), then Arc+(z,\mathrm{Arc}^{+}(z,roman_Arc start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_z , and (Arc+(z,(\mathrm{Arc}^{+}(z,( roman_Arc start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_z ,. So αA has the right-arc property.

For (d), we have

⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈ℬ⋃,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈𝒞|𝒢⁢(,,,α,λx,y)−(1−λ⁢t)|\displaystyle\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}% \rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},% {\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{% \mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},\alpha,\lambda}}{{}_% {x,y}}\right)-(1-\lambda t)\right|⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_B end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) - ( 1 - italic_λ italic_t ) |
=(i)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈ℬ⋃,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈𝒞λ⁢|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(i)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}% {c}{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},% {\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\lambda% \bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{t{\varbbI}-{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{% \alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{% \varbbB}})}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (i) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_B end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(ii)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈ℬ⋃zB∈𝒢(/α)x,yλ|t−zB+𝒢()α⁢𝒜(2zB−1−α𝒢(𝒞)zB)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(ii)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray% }{c}{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({{% }_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}/{{}_{x,y}}\right)}\lambda\left|t-z_{B}+{\mathcal{G}}\left% ({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)(2z_{B}-1-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C% }}\right)z_{B})\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (ii) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_B end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ | italic_t - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) |
=(iii)⋃zB∈𝒢()α⁢ℬλ|t−zB+𝒢()α⁢𝒜(2zB−1−α𝒢(𝒞)zB)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(iii)}}}{{=}}\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{% \mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)}\lambda\left|t-z_{B}+{% \mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)(2z_{B}-1-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}% \left({\mathcal{C}}\right)z_{B})\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (iii) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ | italic_t - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) |
=(iv)|𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYS−(1−λ⁢t)|.superscript(iv)absentsubscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆1𝜆𝑡\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(iv)}}}{{=}}\lvert{\mathcal{Z}}^{% \text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}-(1-% \lambda t)\rvert.start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (iv) end_ARG end_RELOP | caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( 1 - italic_λ italic_t ) | .

Step (i) follows from

|𝒢⁢(,,,α,λx,y)−(1−λ⁢t)|\displaystyle\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{{\varbbA},{\varbbB},{\varbbC},% \alpha,\lambda}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)-(1-\lambda t)\right|\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!% \!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!| caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) - ( 1 - italic_λ italic_t ) |
=|𝒢⁢(λt−λ+αλ(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle=\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{\lambda t{\varbbI}-\lambda% {}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+\lambda{}_{\alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{% \varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}= | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_λ italic_t - italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=λ⁢|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle=\lambda\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{t{\varbbI}-{}_{% \alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{\alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{% \varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}= italic_λ | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |

where we have used (4) and (5) of Lemma 2.8 and Fact 4. We discuss (ii) soon. Step (iii) follows from

𝒢()α⁢ℬ=𝒢(/α⁢ℬ)x,y=⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈ℬ𝒢(/α)x,y,{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)={\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{% \alpha{\mathcal{B}}}/{}_{x,y}\right)=\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbB}% \colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbB}\in{\mathcal{B}}\end{subarray}}{\mathcal{G}}\left({{}_{\alpha{\varbbB% }}}/{{}_{x,y}}\right),caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_B end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where we have used Lemma 2.6. Step (iv) follows from the definition of 𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYSsubscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

We now prove (ii) to conclude the proof. We do so by showing

⋃,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈𝒞|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\!\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{% \varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{% \lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{t{\varbbI}-{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{\alpha{% \varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})% }{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=⋃zB∈𝒢(/α)x,y|t−zB+𝒢()α⁢𝒜(2zB−1−α𝒢(𝒞)zB)|.\displaystyle=\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}/{{}_{% x,y}}\right)}\left|t-z_{B}+{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)(% 2z_{B}-1-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)z_{B})\right|.= ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_t - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | .

If x∉domαx\notin\mathrm{dom}\,{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}italic_x ∉ roman_dom start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT or y∉domαy\notin\mathrm{dom}\,{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}italic_y ∉ roman_dom start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT, the both sides equal ∅\emptyset∅. We now consider two nontrivial cases. First, consider the case (−αt)x≠(−αt)y({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})x\neq({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})y( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) italic_x ≠ ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) italic_y. We have

⋃,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈𝒞|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}% }\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{% \lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{t{\varbbI}-{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{\alpha{% \varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})% }{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♢)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)αα(−αt)x,y)|⁢|𝒢⁢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\diamondsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{% subarray}{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA}% \colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{% t{\varbbI}-{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{\alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{% \varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})}{({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI% })_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{% \varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♢ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) | | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜|𝒢⁢((2−α−α)αα(−αt)x,y)−1|⁢|𝒢⁢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle=\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}% \rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA}% \colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{% {}_{\alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha% {\varbbB}})}{({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})_{x,y}}\right)-1\bigg{\rvert}% \bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}}{{}_{x,y% }}\right)\bigg{\rvert}= ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) - 1 | | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♣)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞|𝒢()α⁢𝒜𝒢(2−α−αα(−αt)x,y)−1||𝒢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\clubsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray% }{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{% \alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{% \varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}{({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}% )_{x,y}}\right)-1\bigg{\rvert}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha% {\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♣ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) - 1 | | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♢)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞|𝒢()α⁢𝒜[𝒢(((2−t−1)−α)α(−αt)x,y)+t−1]−1||𝒢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\diamondsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{% subarray}{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{% \alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)\left[{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{\left((2-t^{-1}){% \varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}\right){}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}{({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{% \varbbI})_{x,y}}\right)+t^{-1}\right]-1\bigg{\rvert}\bigg{\lvert}{\mathcal{G}}% \left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\bigg{\rvert}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♢ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) [ caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG ( ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α ) start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) + italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] - 1 | | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♣)|𝒢()α⁢𝒜[(2−t−1−α𝒢(𝒞))𝒢(α(−αt)x,y)+t−1]−1||𝒢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\clubsuit)}}{{=}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left% ({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)\left[\left(2-t^{-1}-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left(% {\mathcal{C}}\right)\right){\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}{{({}% _{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})}_{x,y}}\right)+t^{-1}\right]-1\right|\left|{% \mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♣ ) end_ARG end_RELOP | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) [ ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) ) caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) + italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] - 1 | | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♢)|𝒢()α⁢𝒜[(2−t−1−α𝒢(𝒞))(1+t𝒢((−αt)x,y))+t−1]−1|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\diamondsuit)}}{{=}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}% \left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)\left[\left(2-t^{-1}-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}% \left({\mathcal{C}}\right)\right)\left(1+t{{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{\varbbI}}% {{({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})}_{x,y}}\right)}\right)+t^{-1}\right]-1\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♢ ) end_ARG end_RELOP | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) [ ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) ) ( 1 + italic_t caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG end_ARG start_ARG ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) ) + italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] - 1 |
⋅|𝒢⁢(−αtx,y)|\displaystyle\quad\cdot\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{% \varbbI}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\right|⋅ | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=⋃zB∈𝒢(/α)x,y|𝒢()α⁢𝒜[(2−t−1−α𝒢(𝒞))(1+t(zB−t)−1)+t−1]−1||zB−t|\displaystyle=\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}/{{}_{% x,y}}\right)}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)\left[% \left(2-t^{-1}-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)\right)(1+t(z_{B}-% t)^{-1})+t^{-1}\right]-1\right|\left|z_{B}-t\right|= ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) [ ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) ) ( 1 + italic_t ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] - 1 | | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_t |
=⋃zB∈𝒢(/α)x,y|t−zB+𝒢()α⁢𝒜(2zB−1−α𝒢(𝒞)zB)|.\displaystyle=\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}/{{}_{% x,y}}\right)}\left|t-z_{B}+{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)(% 2z_{B}-1-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)z_{B})\right|.= ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_t - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | .

where we used (4), (5), and (6) of Lemma 2.8 in (♢)♢(\diamondsuit)( ♢ )’s and we used Corollary 2.12 and Fact 4 in (♣)♣(\clubsuit)( ♣ )’s together with the fact that αA and (2−t−1)−α⁢𝒞2superscript𝑡1𝛼𝒞(2-t^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{C}}( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α caligraphic_C has an arc property. The second step is induced by Fact 4. For the second to last step, we utilized (3), (4), Fact 4, and the fact that 𝒢(/α)x,y{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}/{}_{x,y}\right)caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) is a set of either one real number or one complex conjugate pair. The last step follows from direct calculations.

Now, consider the case (−αt)x=(−αt)y({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})x=({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-t{\varbbI})y( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) italic_x = ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - italic_t ) italic_y. In this case, we have

⋃,:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜,∈𝒞|𝒢⁢(t−+α(2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA},{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}% }\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}},\,{\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{% \mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{t{\varbbI}-{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}+{}_{\alpha{\varbbA}}(2% {}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}})}{{}_{x,y}}% \right)\right|⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL , : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A , ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG italic_t - start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT + start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♢)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒜|𝒢⁢((2−α−α)ααx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\diamondsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{% subarray}{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbA}% \colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbA}\in{\mathcal{A}}\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{{}_{% \alpha{\varbbA}}(2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{% \varbbB}})}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♢ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_A end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♣)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞|𝒢()α⁢𝒜𝒢(2−α−ααx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\clubsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{subarray% }{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{% \mathcal{A}}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{2{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}-{\varbbI}-% \alpha{\varbbC}{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♣ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG 2 start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT - - italic_α start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♢)⋃:ℋ⇉ℋ∈𝒞|𝒢()α⁢𝒜𝒢(((2−t−1)−α)αx,y)|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\diamondsuit)}}{{=}}\bigcup_{\begin{% subarray}{c}{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}\\ {\varbbC}\in{\mathcal{C}}\end{subarray}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{% \mathcal{A}}}\right){\mathcal{G}}\left(\frac{((2-t^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{% \varbbC}){}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}{{}_{x,y}}\right)\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♢ ) end_ARG end_RELOP ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL : caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ∈ caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) caligraphic_G ( divide start_ARG ( ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α ) start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) |
=(♣)|𝒢()α⁢𝒜((2−t−1)−α𝒢(𝒞))𝒢(/α)x,y|\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(\clubsuit)}}{{=}}\left|{\mathcal{G}}\left% ({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)((2-t^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left(% {\mathcal{C}}\right)){\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}/{}_{x,y}\right)\right|start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( ♣ ) end_ARG end_RELOP | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( ( 2 - italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) ) caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) |
=⋃zB∈𝒢(/α)x,y|t−zB+𝒢()α⁢𝒜(2zB−1−α𝒢(𝒞)zB)|,\displaystyle=\bigcup_{z_{B}\in{\mathcal{G}}\left({{}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}}/{{}_{% x,y}}\right)}\left|t-z_{B}+{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)(% 2z_{B}-1-\alpha{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)z_{B})\right|,= ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_t - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ( 2 italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_α caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ,

where we used (7) of Lemma 2.8 in (♢)♢(\diamondsuit)( ♢ )’s and Corollary 2.12 in (♣)♣(\clubsuit)( ♣ )’s. The last step follows from 𝒢(/α)x,y={t}{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\varbbB}}/{}_{x,y}\right)=\{t\}caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT / start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_x , italic_y end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = { italic_t }.

3 Contraction factors of DYS

Using the SRG theory of Section 2, we prove new contraction factors of DYS in three settings of interest. The three contraction factors of Theorems 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 are strictly smaller (better)than the six contraction factors of [17, Theorem D.6] and are, to the best of our knowledge, the best known rates.

Theorem 3.1.

Let 0<α<4⁢β𝒞<∞0𝛼4subscript𝛽𝒞0<\alpha<4\beta_{\mathcal{C}}<\infty0 < italic_α < 4 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞ and λ∈(0,2−α2⁢β𝒞)𝜆02𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞\lambda\in\left(0,2-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\right)italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , 2 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ). Let ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be a real Hilbert space. Let :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be monotone and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be β𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞\beta_{\mathcal{C}}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-cocoercive. If is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz for 0<μ𝒜≤L𝒜<∞0subscript𝜇𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜0<\mu_{\mathcal{A}}\leq L_{\mathcal{A}}<\infty0 < italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞, then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−2⁢λ4−α/β𝒞+λ⁢24−α/β𝒞⁢(24−α/β𝒞−2⁢α⁢μ𝒜α2⁢L𝒜2+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜+1).𝜌12𝜆4𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞𝜆24𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞24𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜1\rho=1-\frac{2\lambda}{4-\alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}+\lambda\sqrt{\frac{2}{4-% \alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\left(\frac{2}{4-\alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}-\frac{% 2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}{\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A% }}+1}\right)}.italic_ρ = 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_λ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_ARG ) end_ARG .

Symmetrically, if is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz for 0<μℬ≤Lℬ<∞0subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿ℬ0<\mu_{\mathcal{B}}\leq L_{\mathcal{B}}<\infty0 < italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞, then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−2⁢λ4−α/β𝒞+λ⁢24−α/β𝒞⁢(24−α/β𝒞−2⁢α⁢μℬα2⁢Lℬ2+2⁢α⁢μℬ+1).𝜌12𝜆4𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞𝜆24𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞24𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬsuperscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿ℬ22𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ1\rho=1-\frac{2\lambda}{4-\alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}+\lambda\sqrt{\frac{2}{4-% \alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\left(\frac{2}{4-\alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}-\frac{% 2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}}}{\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{B}}^{2}+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B% }}+1}\right)}.italic_ρ = 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_λ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_ARG ) end_ARG .

Theorem 3.2.

Let 0<α<4⁢β𝒞<∞0𝛼4subscript𝛽𝒞0<\alpha<4\beta_{\mathcal{C}}<\infty0 < italic_α < 4 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞ and λ∈(0,2−α2⁢β𝒞)𝜆02𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞\lambda\in\left(0,2-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\right)italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , 2 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ). Let ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be a real Hilbert space. Let :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be monotone and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be β𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞\beta_{\mathcal{C}}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-cocoercive. If is L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz and is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone for L𝒜,μℬ∈(0,∞)subscript𝐿𝒜subscript𝜇ℬ0L_{\mathcal{A}},\mu_{\mathcal{B}}\in(0,\infty)italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ), then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−min⁡{2⁢α⁢μℬ⁢λ⁢(2−λ)(1+α2⁢L𝒜2)⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ),2⁢α⁢λ⁢((2−λ)⁢(μℬ+L𝒜)+2⁢α⁢μℬ⁢L𝒜)(1+α⁢L𝒜)2⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ)}.𝜌12𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ𝜆2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ2𝛼𝜆2𝜆subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿𝒜2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿𝒜superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ\rho=\sqrt{1-\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}}\lambda(2-\lambda)}{(1% +\alpha^{2}L_{{\mathcal{A}}}^{2})(2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}})},\frac% {2\alpha\lambda((2-\lambda)(\mu_{\mathcal{B}}+L_{\mathcal{A}})+2\alpha\mu_{% \mathcal{B}}L_{\mathcal{A}})}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})^{2}(2-\lambda+2\alpha% \mu_{\mathcal{B}})}\right\}}.italic_ρ = square-root start_ARG 1 - roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_λ ( ( 2 - italic_λ ) ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG } end_ARG .

Symmetrically, if is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz for μ𝒜,Lℬ∈(0,∞)subscript𝜇𝒜subscript𝐿ℬ0\mu_{\mathcal{A}},L_{\mathcal{B}}\in(0,\infty)italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ), then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−min⁡{2⁢α⁢μ𝒜⁢λ⁢(2−λ)(1+α2⁢Lℬ2)⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜),2⁢α⁢λ⁢((2−λ)⁢(μ𝒜+Lℬ)+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜⁢Lℬ)(1+α⁢Lℬ)2⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜)}.𝜌12𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜𝜆2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿ℬ22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜2𝛼𝜆2𝜆subscript𝜇𝒜subscript𝐿ℬ2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜subscript𝐿ℬsuperscript1𝛼subscript𝐿ℬ22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜\rho=\sqrt{1-\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}\lambda(2-\lambda)}{(1% +\alpha^{2}L_{{\mathcal{B}}}^{2})(2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}})},\frac% {2\alpha\lambda((2-\lambda)(\mu_{\mathcal{A}}+L_{\mathcal{B}})+2\alpha\mu_{% \mathcal{A}}L_{\mathcal{B}})}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{B}})^{2}(2-\lambda+2\alpha% \mu_{\mathcal{A}})}\right\}}.italic_ρ = square-root start_ARG 1 - roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_λ ( ( 2 - italic_λ ) ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG } end_ARG .

Theorem 3.3.

Let 0<α<4⁢β𝒞<∞0𝛼4subscript𝛽𝒞0<\alpha<4\beta_{\mathcal{C}}<\infty0 < italic_α < 4 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞ and λ∈(0,2−α2⁢β𝒞)𝜆02𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞\lambda\in\left(0,2-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\right)italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , 2 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ). Let ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be a real Hilbert space. Let :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be monotone and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be β𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞\beta_{\mathcal{C}}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-cocoercive. If is L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz and is μ𝒞subscript𝜇𝒞\mu_{\mathcal{C}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone for L𝒜∈(0,∞)subscript𝐿𝒜0L_{\mathcal{A}}\in(0,\infty)italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ) and 0<μ𝒞≤1β𝒞0subscript𝜇𝒞1subscript𝛽𝒞0<\mu_{\mathcal{C}}\leq\frac{1}{\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}0 < italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−2⁢λ⁢α⁢min⁡{L𝒜+μ𝒞⁢(1−α2⁢β𝒞⁢(2−λ))(1+α⁢L𝒜)2,μ𝒞⁢(1−α2⁢β𝒞⁢(2−λ))1+α2⁢L𝒜2}.𝜌12𝜆𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜subscript𝜇𝒞1𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2𝜆superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜2subscript𝜇𝒞1𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2\rho=\sqrt{1-2\lambda\alpha\min\left\{\frac{L_{\mathcal{A}}+\mu_{\mathcal{C}}% \left(1-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}(2-\lambda)}\right)}{(1+\alpha L_{% \mathcal{A}})^{2}},\frac{\mu_{\mathcal{C}}\left(1-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{% \mathcal{C}}(2-\lambda)}\right)}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\right\}}.italic_ρ = square-root start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_λ italic_α roman_min { divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } end_ARG .

Symmetrically, if is Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz and is μ𝒞subscript𝜇𝒞\mu_{\mathcal{C}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone for Lℬ∈(0,∞)subscript𝐿ℬ0L_{\mathcal{B}}\in(0,\infty)italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ) and 0<μ𝒞≤1β𝒞0subscript𝜇𝒞1subscript𝛽𝒞0<\mu_{\mathcal{C}}\leq\frac{1}{\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}0 < italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, then ,,,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-contractive with

ρ=1−2⁢λ⁢α⁢min⁡{Lℬ+μ𝒞⁢(1−α2⁢β𝒞⁢(2−λ))(1+α⁢Lℬ)2,μ𝒞⁢(1−α2⁢β𝒞⁢(2−λ))1+α2⁢Lℬ2}.𝜌12𝜆𝛼subscript𝐿ℬsubscript𝜇𝒞1𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2𝜆superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿ℬ2subscript𝜇𝒞1𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿ℬ2\rho=\sqrt{1-2\lambda\alpha\min\left\{\frac{L_{\mathcal{B}}+\mu_{\mathcal{C}}% \left(1-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}(2-\lambda)}\right)}{(1+\alpha L_{% \mathcal{B}})^{2}},\frac{\mu_{\mathcal{C}}\left(1-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{% \mathcal{C}}(2-\lambda)}\right)}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{B}}^{2}}\right\}}.italic_ρ = square-root start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_λ italic_α roman_min { divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } end_ARG .

It is straightforward to verify that the values of ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ in Theorems 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 indeed satisfy ρ<1𝜌1\rho<1italic_ρ < 1, i.e., ,,,α,λ becomes a strict contraction, under the stated range of parameters.

3.1 Proofs of Theorems 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

Before going through proofs, we introduce two elementary Lemmas.

Lemma 3.4.

For a,b,c,d∈[0,∞)𝑎𝑏𝑐𝑑0a,b,c,d\in[0,\infty)italic_a , italic_b , italic_c , italic_d ∈ [ 0 , ∞ ),

(a⁢b+c⁢d)2≤(a+c)⁢(b+d).superscript𝑎𝑏𝑐𝑑2𝑎𝑐𝑏𝑑\left(\sqrt{ab}+\sqrt{cd}\right)^{2}\leq(a+c)(b+d).( square-root start_ARG italic_a italic_b end_ARG + square-root start_ARG italic_c italic_d end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ ( italic_a + italic_c ) ( italic_b + italic_d ) .

Proof 3.5.

This inequality is an instance of Cauchy–Schwarz. It can also be directly shown from (a⁢b+c⁢d)2=(a+c)⁢(b+d)−(a⁢d−b⁢c)2superscript𝑎𝑏𝑐𝑑2𝑎𝑐𝑏𝑑superscript𝑎𝑑𝑏𝑐2\left(\sqrt{ab}+\sqrt{cd}\right)^{2}=(a+c)(b+d)-\left(\sqrt{ad}-\sqrt{bc}% \right)^{2}( square-root start_ARG italic_a italic_b end_ARG + square-root start_ARG italic_c italic_d end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_a + italic_c ) ( italic_b + italic_d ) - ( square-root start_ARG italic_a italic_d end_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_b italic_c end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Lemma 3.6.

Consider a circle with center O𝑂Oitalic_O. Let Q≠O𝑄𝑂Q\neq Oitalic_Q ≠ italic_O be a fixed point. (Q𝑄Qitalic_Q may otherwise be inside, outside, or on the circle.) Let ϕ∈[0,π]italic-ϕ0𝜋\phi\in[0,\pi]italic_ϕ ∈ [ 0 , italic_π ], and let P𝑃Pitalic_P be a point on the circle such that ∠⁢P⁢O⁢Q=ϕ∠𝑃𝑂𝑄italic-ϕ\angle POQ=\phi∠ italic_P italic_O italic_Q = italic_ϕ. Then the length Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG is an increasing function of ϕ∈[0,π]italic-ϕ0𝜋\phi\in[0,\pi]italic_ϕ ∈ [ 0 , italic_π ].

Proof 3.7.

By the law of cosines, Q⁢P¯2=P⁢O¯2+Q⁢O¯2−2⁢P⁢O¯⁢Q⁢O¯⁢cos⁡ϕsuperscript¯𝑄𝑃2superscript¯𝑃𝑂2superscript¯𝑄𝑂22¯𝑃𝑂¯𝑄𝑂italic-ϕ\overline{QP}^{2}=\overline{PO}^{2}+\overline{QO}^{2}-2\overline{PO}\,% \overline{QO}\cos\phiover¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = over¯ start_ARG italic_P italic_O end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_O end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_P italic_O end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_O end_ARG roman_cos italic_ϕ.

Proof 3.8 (Proof of Theorem 3.1).

Consider the first statement, where is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz. Write

𝒜=ℳμ𝒜∩ℒL𝒜,ℬ=ℳ,𝒞=𝒞β𝒞.formulae-sequence𝒜subscriptℳsubscript𝜇𝒜subscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒜formulae-sequenceℬℳ𝒞subscript𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞{\mathcal{A}}={\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}\cap{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{% A}}},\quad{\mathcal{B}}={\mathcal{M}},\quad{\mathcal{C}}={\mathcal{C}}_{\beta_% {\mathcal{C}}}.caligraphic_A = caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_B = caligraphic_M , caligraphic_C = caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Then the first statement is equivalent to saying that A,B,C,α,λ is ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-Lipschitz, where ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ is as given. By Corollary 2.2 and Lemma 1.1, it is enough to show that supz∈𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λDYSsubscriptsupremum𝑧subscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼𝜆\sup_{z\in{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}% },\alpha,\lambda}}roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z ∈ caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |z|𝑧\lvert z\rvert| italic_z | is equal or smaller than ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ, i.e., it is enough to show

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)|≤ρsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆𝜌|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)|\leq\rho| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | ≤ italic_ρ

for any zA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜,zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬz_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right),z_{B}\in% \partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) and zC∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞)subscript𝑧𝐶𝒢𝒞z_{C}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ).

Let θ=24−α/β𝒞𝜃24𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞\theta=\frac{2}{4-\alpha/\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}italic_θ = divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α / italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG.
