≤λ2⁢(θ−1⁢|zA−θ|2+(2−θ−1)⁢|zA|2)⁢(θ−1⁢|zB−θ|2+(2−θ−1)⁢|zB|2),absentsuperscript𝜆2superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴𝜃22superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵𝜃22superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵2\displaystyle\leq\lambda^{2}\left(\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{A}-\theta\rvert^{2}+(2-% \theta^{-1})\lvert z_{A}\rvert^{2}\right)\left(\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{B}-\theta% \rvert^{2}+(2-\theta^{-1})\lvert z_{B}\rvert^{2}\right),≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where the first inequality follows from the triangle inequality and the second is from Lemma 3.4. The second factor simplifies to

θ−1⁢|zB−θ|2+(2−θ−1)⁢|zB|2=2⁢|zB−12|2+θ−12=θ,superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵𝜃22superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵22superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵122𝜃12𝜃\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{B}-\theta\rvert^{2}+(2-\theta^{-1})\lvert z_{B}\rvert^{2}% =2\left|z_{B}-\frac{1}{2}\right|^{2}+\theta-\frac{1}{2}=\theta,italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_θ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG = italic_θ ,

since zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬ=Circ(12,12)z_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)={\mathrm{% Circ}}\left(\frac{1}{2},\frac{1}{2}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) by Fact 2 and 4.

We now bound the first factor. Similarly,

θ−1⁢|zA−θ|2+(2−θ−1)⁢|zA|2=2⁢|zA−12|2+θ−12,superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴𝜃22superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴22superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴122𝜃12\displaystyle\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{A}-\theta\rvert^{2}+(2-\theta^{-1})\lvert z_% {A}\rvert^{2}=2\left|z_{A}-\frac{1}{2}\right|^{2}+\theta-\frac{1}{2},italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_θ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ,

which is maximized (worst case) when |zA−12|subscript𝑧𝐴12\left|z_{A}-\frac{1}{2}\right|| italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | is maximized.

Let

Oμ=12⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜),OL=11−α2⁢L𝒜2formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂𝜇121𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜subscript𝑂𝐿11superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2O_{\mu}=\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}})},\quad O_{L}=\frac{1}{1-\alpha% ^{2}L_{{\mathcal{A}}}^{2}}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG

be the center of ∂𝒢()α⁢ℳμ𝒜\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}}}\right)∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) and the center of ∂𝒢()α⁢ℒL𝒜\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{{\mathcal{A}}}}}\right)∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) (or ∞\infty∞ if α⁢L𝒜=1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜1\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}=1italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1), respectively. Let

P=zA,Q=12,{N,N′}=∂𝒢()α⁢ℒL𝒜∩∂𝒢()α⁢ℳμ𝒜.P=z_{A},\quad Q=\frac{1}{2},\quad\left\{N,N^{\prime}\right\}=\partial{\mathcal% {G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{{\mathcal{A}}}}}\right)\cap\partial{% \mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}}}\right).italic_P = italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Q = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } = ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ∩ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) .

We now characterize the maximum value of Q⁢P¯=|zA−12|¯𝑄𝑃subscript𝑧𝐴12\overline{QP}=\lvert z_{A}-\frac{1}{2}\rvertover¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG = | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | for each of three cases depicted in the figure below. (SRG of resolvent can be easily drawn by inversive geometry introduced in section 2 of [38].)

So Q𝑄Qitalic_Q resides between OLsubscript𝑂𝐿O_{L}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Oμsubscript𝑂𝜇O_{\mu}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In both cases, Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG attains its maximum at P=N𝑃𝑁P=Nitalic_P = italic_N or N′superscript𝑁′N^{\prime}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by Lemma 3.6. If α⁢L𝒜=1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜1\alpha L_{{\mathcal{A}}}=1italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, a similar reasoning shows that Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG attains its maximum at P=N𝑃𝑁P=Nitalic_P = italic_N or N′superscript𝑁′N^{\prime}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by Lemma 3.6.

Thus,

argmaxzA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜|zA−12|={N,N′}=∂𝒢()α⁢ℒL𝒜∩∂𝒢()α⁢ℳμ𝒜.\operatorname*{argmax}_{z_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal% {A}}}\right)}\,\bigg{\lvert}z_{A}-\frac{1}{2}\bigg{\rvert}=\{N,N^{\prime}\}=% \partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{A}}}}\right)% \cap\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}}% \right).roman_argmax start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | = { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } = ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ∩ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) .

we bound the first factor as

Finally, we conclude

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)|subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆\displaystyle\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)\rvert| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | ≤|1−λ⁢θ|+|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)−(1−λ⁢θ)|absent1𝜆𝜃subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆1𝜆𝜃\displaystyle\leq\lvert 1-\lambda\theta\rvert+\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z% _{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)-(1-\lambda\theta)\rvert≤ | 1 - italic_λ italic_θ | + | italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) - ( 1 - italic_λ italic_θ ) |
≤1−λ⁢θ+λ⁢θ⁢(θ−2⁢α⁢μ𝒜α2⁢L𝒜2+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜+1).absent1𝜆𝜃𝜆𝜃𝜃2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜1\displaystyle\leq 1-\lambda\theta+\lambda\sqrt{\theta\left(\theta-\frac{2% \alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}{\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}% }+1}\right)}.≤ 1 - italic_λ italic_θ + italic_λ square-root start_ARG italic_θ ( italic_θ - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_ARG ) end_ARG .

Note that λ<2−α2⁢β𝒞=θ−1𝜆2𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞superscript𝜃1\lambda<2-\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}=\theta^{-1}italic_λ < 2 - divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. So 1−λ⁢θ>01𝜆𝜃01-\lambda\theta>01 - italic_λ italic_θ > 0. This completes the proof for the first statement.

Since ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) is symmetric with respect to zAsubscript𝑧𝐴z_{A}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and zBsubscript𝑧𝐵z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the second statement follows from the same argument.

Proof 3.9 (Proof of Theorem 3.2).

Consider the first statement, where is L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz and is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone. Write

𝒜=ℳ∩ℒL𝒜,ℬ=ℳμℬ,𝒞=𝒞β𝒞.formulae-sequence𝒜ℳsubscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒜formulae-sequenceℬsubscriptℳsubscript𝜇ℬ𝒞subscript𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞{\mathcal{A}}={\mathcal{M}}\cap{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{A}}},\quad{\mathcal{% B}}={\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{B}}},\quad{\mathcal{C}}={\mathcal{C}}_{\beta_% {\mathcal{C}}}.caligraphic_A = caligraphic_M ∩ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_B = caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_C = caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

By the same reasoning as for Theorem 3.1, it suffices to show

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)|≤ρsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆𝜌\left|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)\right|\leq\rho| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | ≤ italic_ρ

for any zA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜z_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬz_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), and zC∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞)subscript𝑧𝐶𝒢𝒞z_{C}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C ).

Let

Oβ=α2⁢β𝒞,P=α⁢zC,Q=2−λ,Z=0,formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂𝛽𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞formulae-sequence𝑃𝛼subscript𝑧𝐶formulae-sequence𝑄2𝜆𝑍0O_{\beta}=\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}},\quad P=\alpha z_{C},\quad Q=2-% \lambda,\quad Z=0,italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , italic_P = italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Q = 2 - italic_λ , italic_Z = 0 ,

as depicted in the following figure.

Observe that α⁢zC∈Circ⁢(α2⁢β𝒞,α2⁢β𝒞)𝛼subscript𝑧𝐶Circ𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞\alpha z_{C}\in{\mathrm{Circ}}\left(\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}},\frac{% \alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\right)italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ). Since we assume 2−λ>α2⁢β𝒞2𝜆𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2-\lambda>\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}2 - italic_λ > divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, Q𝑄Qitalic_Q is on the right side of Oβsubscript𝑂𝛽O_{\beta}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, |2−λ−α⁢zC|=Q⁢P¯≤Q⁢Z¯=2−λ2𝜆𝛼subscript𝑧𝐶¯𝑄𝑃¯𝑄𝑍2𝜆\lvert 2-\lambda-\alpha z_{C}\rvert=\overline{QP}\leq\overline{QZ}=2-\lambda| 2 - italic_λ - italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | = over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG ≤ over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_Z end_ARG = 2 - italic_λ by Lemma 3.6. Then, we have

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)|2superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆2\displaystyle\left|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)\right|% ^{2}| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=|(1−λ⁢zA)⁢(1−λ⁢zB)+λ⁢(2−λ−α⁢zC)⁢zA⁢zB|2absentsuperscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐵𝜆2𝜆𝛼subscript𝑧𝐶subscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵2\displaystyle=\left|(1-\lambda z_{A})(1-\lambda z_{B})+\lambda(2-\lambda-% \alpha z_{C})z_{A}z_{B}\right|^{2}= | ( 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ - italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

for any r>0𝑟0r>0italic_r > 0, where the first inequality follows from the triangle inequality, the second is from Q⁢P¯≤Q⁢Z¯¯𝑄𝑃¯𝑄𝑍\overline{QP}\leq\overline{QZ}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG ≤ over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_Z end_ARG, and the third is from Lemma 3.4. Set

The second factor simplifies to

since zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬ=Circ(12⁢(1+α⁢μℬ),12⁢(1+α⁢μℬ))z_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)={\mathrm{% Circ}}\left(\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}})},\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{{% \mathcal{B}}})}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ). Let

O0=12,OL=11−α2⁢L𝒜2,P=zA,Q=1λ+(2−λ)⁢r−1,formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂012formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂𝐿11superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2formulae-sequence𝑃subscript𝑧𝐴𝑄1𝜆2𝜆superscript𝑟1\displaystyle O_{0}=\frac{1}{2},\quad O_{L}=\frac{1}{1-\alpha^{2}L_{{\mathcal{% A}}}^{2}},\quad P=z_{A},\quad Q=\frac{1}{\lambda+(2-\lambda)r^{-1}},italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , italic_P = italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Q = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + ( 2 - italic_λ ) italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ,
M=11+α⁢L𝒜,{N,N′}=∂𝒢()α⁢ℒL𝒜∩∂𝒢()α⁢ℳ=11+α2⁢L𝒜2(1±iαL𝒜).\displaystyle M=\frac{1}{1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}},\quad\left\{N,N^{\prime}% \right\}=\partial{\mathcal{G}}\big{(}{}_{\alpha{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{A}}}% }\big{)}\cap\partial{\mathcal{G}}\big{(}{}_{\alpha{\mathcal{M}}}\big{)}=\frac{% 1}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\left(1\pm i\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}\right).italic_M = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } = ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ∩ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_M end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 ± italic_i italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

We now characterize the maximum value of Q⁢P¯=|zA−1λ+(2−λ)⁢r−1|¯𝑄𝑃subscript𝑧𝐴1𝜆2𝜆superscript𝑟1\overline{QP}=\lvert z_{A}-\frac{1}{\lambda+(2-\lambda)r^{-1}}\rvertover¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG = | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + ( 2 - italic_λ ) italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG |. First, note that Q𝑄Qitalic_Q is on the right side of O0subscript𝑂0O_{0}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, since r=2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ2−λ>1𝑟2𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ2𝜆1r=\frac{2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}}}{2-\lambda}>1italic_r = divide start_ARG 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG > 1 and thus Q=1λ+(2−λ)⁢r−1>12=O0𝑄1𝜆2𝜆superscript𝑟112subscript𝑂0Q=\frac{1}{\lambda+(2-\lambda)r^{-1}}>\frac{1}{2}=O_{0}italic_Q = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + ( 2 - italic_λ ) italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG = italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Four cases in the following figure cover all possibilities (including the case O0≤Q≤Msubscript𝑂0𝑄𝑀O_{0}\leq Q\leq Mitalic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_Q ≤ italic_M, in particular), and we can confirm that Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG attains its maximum at P=M𝑃𝑀P=Mitalic_P = italic_M or P∈{N,N′}𝑃𝑁superscript𝑁′P\in\{N,N^{\prime}\}italic_P ∈ { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } in each case by applying Lemma 3.6 together with the fact that Q𝑄Qitalic_Q is on the right side of O0subscript𝑂0O_{0}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

If Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG attains its maximum at P=M𝑃𝑀P=Mitalic_P = italic_M, i.e., zA=11+α⁢L𝒜subscript𝑧𝐴11𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜z_{A}=\frac{1}{1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG,

|1−λ⁢zA|2+r−1⁢λ⁢(2−λ)⁢|zA|2=1−2⁢α⁢λ⁢(μℬ⁢(2−λ)+L𝒜⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ))(1+α⁢L𝒜)2⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ).superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2superscript𝑟1𝜆2𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴212𝛼𝜆subscript𝜇ℬ2𝜆subscript𝐿𝒜2𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬsuperscript1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ\displaystyle\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}+r^{-1}\lambda(2-\lambda)\lvert z% _{A}\rvert^{2}=1-\frac{2\alpha\lambda(\mu_{\mathcal{B}}(2-\lambda)+L_{\mathcal% {A}}(2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}}))}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})^{2}(2-% \lambda+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}})}.| 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_λ ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG .

Otherwise, if Q⁢P¯¯𝑄𝑃\overline{QP}over¯ start_ARG italic_Q italic_P end_ARG attains its maximum at P∈{N,N′}𝑃𝑁superscript𝑁′P\in\{N,N^{\prime}\}italic_P ∈ { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT }, i.e., zA∈11+α2⁢L𝒜2⁢(1±i⁢α⁢L𝒜)subscript𝑧𝐴11superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2plus-or-minus1𝑖𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜z_{A}\in\frac{1}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}(1\pm i\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 ± italic_i italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ),

|1−λ⁢zA|2+r−1⁢λ⁢(2−λ)⁢|zA|2=1−2⁢α⁢μℬ⁢λ⁢(2−λ)(1+α2⁢L𝒜2)⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ).superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2superscript𝑟1𝜆2𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴212𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ𝜆2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ\displaystyle\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}+r^{-1}\lambda(2-\lambda)\lvert z% _{A}\rvert^{2}=1-\frac{2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}}\lambda(2-\lambda)}{(1+\alpha% ^{2}L_{{\mathcal{A}}}^{2})(2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}})}.| 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG .

Therefore,

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)|2superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆2\displaystyle\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)\rvert^% {2}| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤1−min⁡{2⁢α⁢μℬ⁢λ⁢(2−λ)(1+α2⁢L𝒜2)⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ),2⁢α⁢λ⁢((2−λ)⁢(μℬ+L𝒜)+2⁢α⁢μℬ⁢L𝒜)(1+α⁢L𝒜)2⁢(2−λ+2⁢α⁢μℬ)}.absent12𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ𝜆2𝜆1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ2𝛼𝜆2𝜆subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿𝒜2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿𝒜superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ\displaystyle\leq 1-\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{B}}}\lambda(2-% \lambda)}{(1+\alpha^{2}L_{{\mathcal{A}}}^{2})(2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{% B}}})},\frac{2\alpha\lambda((2-\lambda)(\mu_{\mathcal{B}}+L_{\mathcal{A}})+2% \alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}}L_{\mathcal{A}})}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})^{2}(2-% \lambda+2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B}})}\right\}.≤ 1 - roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_λ ( ( 2 - italic_λ ) ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG } .

This completes the proof for the first statement.

Since ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC;α,λ)subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧𝐶𝛼𝜆\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C};\alpha,\lambda)italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) is symmetric with respect to zAsubscript𝑧𝐴z_{A}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and zBsubscript𝑧𝐵z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the second statement follows from the same argument.

Proof 3.10 (Proof of Theorem 3.3).

First consider the first case, where is L𝒜subscript𝐿𝒜L_{\mathcal{A}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz and is μ𝒞subscript𝜇𝒞\mu_{\mathcal{C}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone. Write

𝒜=ℳ∩ℒL𝒜,ℬ=ℳ,𝒞=ℳμ𝒞∩𝒞β𝒞.formulae-sequence𝒜ℳsubscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒜formulae-sequenceℬℳ𝒞subscriptℳsubscript𝜇𝒞subscript𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞{\mathcal{A}}={\mathcal{M}}\cap{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{A}}},\quad{\mathcal{% B}}={\mathcal{M}},\quad{\mathcal{C}}={\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{C}}}\cap{% \mathcal{C}}_{\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}.caligraphic_A = caligraphic_M ∩ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_B = caligraphic_M , caligraphic_C = caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Let

O=2−λα,Oβ=12⁢β𝒞,{N,N′}=∂𝒢⁢(ℳμ𝒞)∩∂𝒢⁢(𝒞β𝒞).formulae-sequence𝑂2𝜆𝛼formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂𝛽12subscript𝛽𝒞𝑁superscript𝑁′𝒢subscriptℳsubscript𝜇𝒞𝒢subscript𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞O=\frac{2-\lambda}{\alpha},\quad O_{\beta}=\frac{1}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}},% \quad\{N,N^{\prime}\}=\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{% C}}}\right)\cap\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}_{\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}% \right).italic_O = divide start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } = ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∩ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Define

𝒞′=α−1⁢((2−λ)+ℒR)superscript𝒞′superscript𝛼12𝜆subscriptℒ𝑅{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}=\alpha^{-1}((2-\lambda){\varbbI}+{\mathcal{L}}_{R})caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( 2 - italic_λ ) + caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

so that (2−λ)−α⁢𝒞′=ℒR2𝜆𝛼superscript𝒞′subscriptℒ𝑅(2-\lambda){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}={\mathcal{L}}_{R}( 2 - italic_λ ) - italic_α caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfies an arc property and set R𝑅Ritalic_R to the minimum value that satisfies 𝒞⊂𝒞′𝒞superscript𝒞′{\mathcal{C}}\subset{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}caligraphic_C ⊂ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Observe that 𝒢⁢(𝒞′)𝒢superscript𝒞′{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is centered at O𝑂Oitalic_O, which is on the right side of Oβsubscript𝑂𝛽O_{\beta}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β end_POSTSUBSCRIPT since 2−λ>α2⁢β𝒞2𝜆𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2-\lambda>\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}2 - italic_λ > divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Therefore, we have

R=α⁢O⁢N¯=(2−λ)⁢(2−λ−2⁢(1−η)⁢α⁢μ𝒞)𝑅𝛼¯𝑂𝑁2𝜆2𝜆21𝜂𝛼subscript𝜇𝒞\displaystyle R=\alpha\overline{ON}=\sqrt{(2-\lambda)(2-\lambda-2(1-\eta)% \alpha\mu_{\mathcal{C}})}italic_R = italic_α over¯ start_ARG italic_O italic_N end_ARG = square-root start_ARG ( 2 - italic_λ ) ( 2 - italic_λ - 2 ( 1 - italic_η ) italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG

with η=α2⁢β𝒞⁢(2−λ)𝜂𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞2𝜆\eta=\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}(2-\lambda)}italic_η = divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG, as depicted in the following figure.

By Corollary 2.4, it suffices to show

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)|≤ρsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆𝜌\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,\lambda)\rvert\leq\rho| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | ≤ italic_ρ

for any zA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜z_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬz_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), and zC′∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞′)subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝒢superscript𝒞′z_{C^{\prime}}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). We have

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)|2superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆2\displaystyle\left|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,% \lambda)\right|^{2}| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=|(1−λ⁢zA)⁢(1−λ⁢zB)+λ⁢(2−λ−α⁢zC′)⁢zA⁢zB|2absentsuperscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐵𝜆2𝜆𝛼subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′subscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵2\displaystyle=\left|(1-\lambda z_{A})(1-\lambda z_{B})+\lambda(2-\lambda-% \alpha z_{C^{\prime}})z_{A}z_{B}\right|^{2}= | ( 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ - italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

=(|1−λ⁢zA|2⁢|1−λ⁢zB|2+(r−1⁢λ⁢R⁢|zA|2)⁢(r⁢λ⁢R⁢|zB|2))2absentsuperscriptsuperscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐵2superscript𝑟1𝜆𝑅superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2𝑟𝜆𝑅superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵22\displaystyle=\left(\sqrt{\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}\lvert 1-\lambda z_{% B}\rvert^{2}}+\sqrt{\left(r^{-1}\lambda R\lvert z_{A}\rvert^{2}\right)\left(r% \lambda R\lvert z_{B}\rvert^{2}\right)}\right)^{2}= ( square-root start_ARG | 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + square-root start_ARG ( italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ italic_R | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_r italic_λ italic_R | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤(|1−λ⁢zA|2+r−1⁢λ⁢R⁢|zA|2)⁢(|1−λ⁢zB|2+r⁢λ⁢R⁢|zB|2)absentsuperscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2superscript𝑟1𝜆𝑅superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐵2𝑟𝜆𝑅superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵2\displaystyle\leq\left(\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}+r^{-1}\lambda R\lvert z% _{A}\rvert^{2}\right)\left(\lvert 1-\lambda z_{B}\rvert^{2}+r\lambda R\lvert z% _{B}\rvert^{2}\right)≤ ( | 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ italic_R | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( | 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_r italic_λ italic_R | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

for any r>0𝑟0r>0italic_r > 0, where first inequality follows from the triangle inequality, second equality follows from zC′∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞′)=Circ⁢(2−λα,Rα)subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝒢superscript𝒞′Circ2𝜆𝛼𝑅𝛼z_{C^{\prime}}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)={% \mathrm{Circ}}\left(\frac{2-\lambda}{\alpha},\frac{R}{\alpha}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG ), and last inequality follows from Lemma 3.4. Set

r=2−λR𝑟2𝜆𝑅r=\frac{2-\lambda}{R}italic_r = divide start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_R end_ARG

and the second factor simplifies to

|1−λ⁢zB|2+r⁢λ⁢R⁢|zB|2=2⁢λ⁢|zB−12|2+1−λ2=1superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐵2𝑟𝜆𝑅superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵22𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵1221𝜆21\lvert 1-\lambda z_{B}\rvert^{2}+r\lambda R\lvert z_{B}\rvert^{2}=2\lambda% \left|z_{B}-\frac{1}{2}\right|^{2}+1-\frac{\lambda}{2}=1| 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_r italic_λ italic_R | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 italic_λ | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 1 - divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG = 1

as zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬ=Circ(12,12)z_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)={\mathrm{% Circ}}\left(\frac{1}{2},\frac{1}{2}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ). Therefore,

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)|2superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆2\displaystyle\left|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,% \lambda)\right|^{2}| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤|1−λ⁢zA|2+λ⁢R22−λ⁢|zA|2absentsuperscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2\displaystyle\leq\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}+\lambda\frac{R^{2}}{2-% \lambda}\lvert z_{A}\rvert^{2}≤ | 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=(λ2+λ⁢R22−λ)⁢|zA−1λ+R2/(2−λ)|2+1−λλ+R2/(2−λ),absentsuperscript𝜆2𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴1𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆21𝜆𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆\displaystyle=\left(\lambda^{2}+\lambda\frac{R^{2}}{2-\lambda}\right)\left|z_{% A}-\frac{1}{\lambda+R^{2}/(2-\lambda)}\right|^{2}+1-\frac{\lambda}{\lambda+R^{% 2}/(2-\lambda)},= ( italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 1 - divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG ,

which is maximized when |zA−1λ+R2/(2−λ)|subscript𝑧𝐴1𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆\left|z_{A}-\frac{1}{\lambda+R^{2}/(2-\lambda)}\right|| italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG | is maximized. By the same reasoning as that of Theorem 3.2, the maximum is attained at zA=11+α2⁢L𝒜2⁢(1±i⁢α⁢L𝒜)subscript𝑧𝐴11superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2plus-or-minus1𝑖𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜z_{A}=\frac{1}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}(1\pm i\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 ± italic_i italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) or zA=11+α⁢L𝒜subscript𝑧𝐴11𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜z_{A}=\frac{1}{1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. (Since 𝒜=ℳ∩ℒL𝒜𝒜ℳsubscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒜{\mathcal{A}}={\mathcal{M}}\cap{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{A}}}caligraphic_A = caligraphic_M ∩ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for both the current setup and that of Theorem 3.2, the illustration of 𝒢()α⁢𝒜{\mathcal{G}}({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}})caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) is identical and Q=1λ+R2/(2−λ)>12=O0𝑄1𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆12subscript𝑂0Q=\frac{1}{\lambda+R^{2}/(2-\lambda)}>\frac{1}{2}=O_{0}italic_Q = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG = italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT implies Q𝑄Qitalic_Q is on the right side of O0subscript𝑂0O_{0}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT). In the first case where zA=11+α⁢L𝒜subscript𝑧𝐴11𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜z_{A}=\frac{1}{1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}}}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG is a maxima,

|1−λ⁢zA|2+λ⁢R22−λ⁢|zA|2superscript1𝜆subscript𝑧𝐴2𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2\displaystyle\lvert 1-\lambda z_{A}\rvert^{2}+\lambda\frac{R^{2}}{2-\lambda}% \lvert z_{A}\rvert^{2}| 1 - italic_λ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =1+11+α2⁢L𝒜2⁢(−2⁢λ+λ2+λ⁢R22−λ)absent111superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆superscript𝜆2𝜆superscript𝑅22𝜆\displaystyle=1+\frac{1}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\left(-2\lambda+% \lambda^{2}+\frac{\lambda R^{2}}{2-\lambda}\right)= 1 + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( - 2 italic_λ + italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_λ italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ end_ARG )
=1−2⁢λ⁢α⁢μ𝒞⁢(1−η)1+α2⁢L𝒜2.absent12𝜆𝛼subscript𝜇𝒞1𝜂1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2\displaystyle=1-\frac{2\lambda\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{C}}(1-\eta)}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{% \mathcal{A}}^{2}}.= 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_λ italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_η ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

Therefore,

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)|2≤1−min⁡{2⁢λ⁢α⁢(L𝒜+(1−η)⁢μ𝒞)(1+α⁢L𝒜)2,2⁢λ⁢α⁢μ𝒞⁢(1−η)1+α2⁢L𝒜2}.superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆212𝜆𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜1𝜂subscript𝜇𝒞superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿𝒜22𝜆𝛼subscript𝜇𝒞1𝜂1superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜2\displaystyle\left|\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,% \lambda)\right|^{2}\leq 1-\min\left\{\frac{2\lambda\alpha(L_{\mathcal{A}}+(1-% \eta)\mu_{\mathcal{C}})}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{A}})^{2}},\frac{2\lambda\alpha% \mu_{\mathcal{C}}(1-\eta)}{1+\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\right\}.| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ 1 - roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_λ italic_α ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( 1 - italic_η ) italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_λ italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_η ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } .

This completes the proof for the first statement.

Since ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,\lambda)italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) is symmetric with respect to zAsubscript𝑧𝐴z_{A}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and zBsubscript𝑧𝐵z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the second statement follows from the same argument.

3.2 Comparison to prior factors

3.2.1 Contraction factors of DYS

Our contraction factors of Theorems 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 are smaller (better) than the six prior contraction factors of [17, Theorem D.6]. However, accurate comparisons require making appropriate updates to the prior results.

Theorem D.6 of [17] presents six contraction factors, which are obtained by making certain substitutions to the equation (D.33) of [17]. Carefully carrying out these calculations leads to the following updates. In Theorem D.6.1 of [17], the contraction factor assuming conditions of the second statement of our Theorem 3.1 (so is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz) should be updated to

ρ=1−2⁢μℬ⁢α⁢λ(1+α⁢Lℬ)2.𝜌12subscript𝜇ℬ𝛼𝜆superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿ℬ2\rho=\sqrt{1-\frac{2\mu_{\mathcal{B}}\alpha\lambda}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{B}})% ^{2}}}.italic_ρ = square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_α italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG .

In Theorem D.6.3 and D.6.4 of [17], the contraction factors assuming conditions of our Theorem 3.2 (so is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz, and vice-versa) should be updated to

ρ𝜌\displaystyle\rhoitalic_ρ =1−λ3⁢min⁡{2⁢α⁢μ𝒜(1+α⁢Lℬ)2,λ1+2⁢α2⁢Lℬ2⁢(2−ϵλ−1)},absent1𝜆32𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿ℬ2𝜆12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿ℬ22italic-ϵ𝜆1\displaystyle=\sqrt{1-\frac{\lambda}{3}\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A% }}}{(1+\alpha L_{\mathcal{B}})^{2}},\frac{\lambda}{1+2\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{B}% }^{2}}\left(\frac{2-\epsilon}{\lambda}-1\right)\right\}},= square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 3 end_ARG roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 1 + 2 italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( divide start_ARG 2 - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG - 1 ) } end_ARG ,
ρ′superscript𝜌′\displaystyle\rho^{\prime}italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =1−λ4⁢min⁡{2⁢α⁢μℬ1+2⁢α2⁢L𝒜2,2⁢β𝒞−α/ϵα,λ1+2⁢α2⁢L𝒜2⁢(2−ϵλ−1)}absent1𝜆42𝛼subscript𝜇ℬ12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼italic-ϵ𝛼𝜆12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22italic-ϵ𝜆1\displaystyle=\sqrt{1-\frac{\lambda}{4}\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{B% }}}{1+2\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}},\frac{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-\alpha/% \epsilon}{\alpha},\frac{\lambda}{1+2\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\left(\frac{% 2-\epsilon}{\lambda}-1\right)\right\}}= square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 + 2 italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_α / italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 1 + 2 italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( divide start_ARG 2 - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG - 1 ) } end_ARG

respectively, where ϵ∈(α2⁢β𝒞,min⁡(1,2−λ))italic-ϵ𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞12𝜆\epsilon\in(\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}},\min(1,2-\lambda))italic_ϵ ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , roman_min ( 1 , 2 - italic_λ ) ). In Theorem D.6.5 and D.6.6 of [17], the contraction factors assuming conditions of our Theorem 3.3 (so is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is L𝒞subscript𝐿𝒞L_{\mathcal{C}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz, and is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is L𝒞subscript𝐿𝒞L_{\mathcal{C}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz) should be updated to

ρ𝜌\displaystyle\rhoitalic_ρ =1−λ4⁢min⁡{2⁢α⁢μ𝒞⁢(1−η)1+2⁢α2⁢L𝒜2,2⁢η⁢β𝒞−α/ϵα,λ1+2⁢α2⁢L𝒜2⁢(2−ϵλ−1)},absent1𝜆42𝛼subscript𝜇𝒞1𝜂12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22𝜂subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼italic-ϵ𝛼𝜆12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒜22italic-ϵ𝜆1\displaystyle=\sqrt{1-\frac{\lambda}{4}\min\left\{\frac{2\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{C% }}(1-\eta)}{1+2\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}},\frac{2\eta\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-% \alpha/\epsilon}{\alpha},\frac{\lambda}{1+2\alpha^{2}L_{\mathcal{A}}^{2}}\left% (\frac{2-\epsilon}{\lambda}-1\right)\right\}},= square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG roman_min { divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_η ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + 2 italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_η italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_α / italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 1 + 2 italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( divide start_ARG 2 - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG - 1 ) } end_ARG ,
ρ′superscript𝜌′\displaystyle\rho^{\prime}italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =1−2⁢α⁢λ⁢μ𝒞⁢(1−η)(1+α⁢Lℬ)2,absent12𝛼𝜆subscript𝜇𝒞1𝜂superscript1𝛼subscript𝐿ℬ2\displaystyle=\sqrt{1-\frac{2\alpha\lambda\mu_{\mathcal{C}}(1-\eta)}{(1+\alpha L% _{\mathcal{B}})^{2}}},= square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_λ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_η ) end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 + italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ,

where η∈(0,1)𝜂01\eta\in(0,1)italic_η ∈ ( 0 , 1 ) is a constant satisfying η>α2⁢β𝒞⁢ϵ𝜂𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞italic-ϵ\eta>\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}\epsilon}italic_η > divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_ARG. (ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ is as defined previously).

By simple calculation, we could verify that our six contraction factors are strictly better than those updated prior rates, respectively. The detailed calculations comparing our rates against the prior rates of [17] are carried out in the arXiv version of this paper [27, Section 3.2]. In this section, we want to focus on the numerical results of this comparison with the worst-case rate obtained by the performance estimation problem (PEP) framework [20, 43, 39]. For a fair comparison with prior rates, we optimize the choice of ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ and η𝜂\etaitalic_η to minimize the factors above and compare with our results. As depicted in Figure 1, the contraction factors we derived are much closer to the tight contraction factors evaluated by the PEP approach. In this sense, our contraction factors are a better proxy of the tight contraction factors than the earlier results in [17]. We further investigate the advantages of our rates in assessing the computational cost, especially in an ill-conditioned case where the coefficient of the strong monotonicity μ𝜇\muitalic_μ imposed to 𝒜𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A, ℬℬ{\mathcal{B}}caligraphic_B, or 𝒞𝒞{\mathcal{C}}caligraphic_C is infinitesimal. For the six cases addressed in Theorems 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3, one can simply plug in μ=0𝜇0\mu=0italic_μ = 0 and confirm that the contraction factor ρ=1𝜌1\rho=1italic_ρ = 1 in such a case (μ𝜇\muitalic_μ is one of the μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, or μ𝒞subscript𝜇𝒞\mu_{\mathcal{C}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT appearing in each case). The same applies to the contraction rates provided in the earlier work. Therefore, one can approximate a contraction factor ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ via the first-order Taylor series expansion: ρ≈1+μ⁢(d⁢ρ/d⁢μ|μ=0)𝜌1𝜇evaluated-at𝑑𝜌𝑑𝜇𝜇0\rho\approx 1+\mu(d\rho/d\mu|_{\mu=0})italic_ρ ≈ 1 + italic_μ ( italic_d italic_ρ / italic_d italic_μ | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). If we want to evaluate the computational cost to reach a predetermined degree of error, we should consider

−1log⁡ρ≈−1log⁡(1+μ⁢(d⁢ρd⁢μ|μ=0))≈−1μ⁢(d⁢ρd⁢μ|μ=0)1𝜌11𝜇evaluated-at𝑑𝜌𝑑𝜇𝜇01𝜇evaluated-at𝑑𝜌𝑑𝜇𝜇0-\frac{1}{\log\rho}\approx-\frac{1}{\log\left(1+\mu\left(\frac{d\rho}{d\mu}|_{% \mu=0}\right)\right)}\approx-\frac{1}{\mu\left(\frac{d\rho}{d\mu}|_{\mu=0}% \right)}- divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log italic_ρ end_ARG ≈ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log ( 1 + italic_μ ( divide start_ARG italic_d italic_ρ end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_μ end_ARG | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG ≈ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_μ ( divide start_ARG italic_d italic_ρ end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_μ end_ARG | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG

as it is proportional to the upper bound of the total number of iterations. Therefore, denoting the contraction factors in our and the previous work [17] by ρourssubscript𝜌ours\rho_{\mathrm{ours}}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ours end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ρprevsubscript𝜌prev\rho_{\mathrm{prev}}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_prev end_POSTSUBSCRIPT respectively, d⁢ρoursd⁢μ/d⁢ρprevd⁢μ|μ=0\frac{d\rho_{\mathrm{ours}}}{d\mu}/\frac{d\rho_{\mathrm{prev}}}{d\mu}\rvert_{% \mu=0}divide start_ARG italic_d italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ours end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_μ end_ARG / divide start_ARG italic_d italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_prev end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_μ end_ARG | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT would be an appropriate proxy to assess which of two are better; larger the value is, better our factor is. As presented in Table 1, this value is strictly larger than 1111 in every case, meaning that our factors are always better than the prior factors. Indeed, these discrepancies are even higher than 4444 in some cases, supporting significant improvement of our results in the sense we are aware of.

3.2.2 Contraction factors of FBS

As DYS generalizes various two-operator splittings such as FBS and DRS, it is natural to ask what contraction rates are induced by our results in two-operator splitting setups and how strong they are compared to prior results. In particular, plugging =0absent0{\varbbB}=0= 0 into ,,,α,λ gives =,0,,α,λ(1−λ)+λ(−α)α{}_{{\varbbA},0,{\varbbC},\alpha,\lambda}=(1-\lambda){\varbbI}+\lambda{}_{% \alpha{\varbbA}}({\varbbI}-\alpha{\varbbC})start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT , 0 , , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 - italic_λ ) + italic_λ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ( - italic_α ), an averaged version of the FBS operator. We consider a case where is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is β𝒞subscript𝛽𝒞\beta_{\mathcal{C}}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-cocoercive, which is also studied by Guo [23]. We first establish the contraction factor of FBS implied by Theorem 3.2 and compare it with the rate provided in [23].

Recall that the second instance of Theorem 3.2; since =0absent0{\varbbB}=0= 0 is Lℬsubscript𝐿ℬL_{\mathcal{B}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz for any Lℬ>0subscript𝐿ℬ0L_{\mathcal{B}}>0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, the contraction factor stated in Theorem 3.2 is valid for any Lℬ>0subscript𝐿ℬ0L_{\mathcal{B}}>0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 in this case. Therefore, we can guarantee that ,0,,α,λ has a contraction factor smaller than or equal to the infimum of those factors. Therefore, ,0,,α,λ is ρourssubscript𝜌ours\rho_{\mathrm{ours}}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ours end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-contractive where

ρours=1−2⁢α⁢μ𝒜⁢λ⁢(2−λ)2−λ+2⁢α⁢μ𝒜.subscript𝜌ours12𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜𝜆2𝜆2𝜆2𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜\displaystyle\rho_{\mathrm{ours}}=\sqrt{1-\frac{2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}% \lambda(2-\lambda)}{2-\lambda+2\alpha\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}}}.italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ours end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = square-root start_ARG 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( 2 - italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 - italic_λ + 2 italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG .

The prior rate provided in Theorem 3.1 of [23] is translated

ρprev={1−λ⁢(1−2⁢β𝒞−α+α2⁢μ𝒜2⁢α⁢β𝒞⁢μ𝒜+2⁢β𝒞−α)if ⁢0<λ≤8⁢α⁢β𝒞2⁢μ𝒜+4⁢β𝒞⁢(2⁢β𝒞−α)8⁢α⁢β𝒞2⁢μ𝒜+(2⁢β𝒞+α)⁢(2⁢β𝒞−α),(1+α2⁢β𝒞)⁢λ−1if ⁢8⁢α⁢β𝒞2⁢μ𝒜+4⁢β𝒞⁢(2⁢β𝒞−α)8⁢α⁢β𝒞2⁢μ𝒜+(2⁢β𝒞+α)⁢(2⁢β𝒞−α)<λ<2.subscript𝜌prevcases1𝜆12subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼superscript𝛼2subscript𝜇𝒜2𝛼subscript𝛽𝒞subscript𝜇𝒜2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼if 0𝜆8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜4subscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼1𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞𝜆1if 8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜4subscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝛽𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼2subscript𝛽𝒞𝛼𝜆2\rho_{\mathrm{prev}}=\begin{cases}1-\lambda\left(1-\frac{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-% \alpha+\alpha^{2}\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}{2\alpha\beta_{\mathcal{C}}\mu_{\mathcal{A}% }+2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-\alpha}\right)&\text{if }0<\lambda\leq\frac{8\alpha% \beta_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}\mu_{\mathcal{A}}+4\beta_{\mathcal{C}}(2\beta_{\mathcal% {C}}-\alpha)}{8\alpha\beta_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}\mu_{\mathcal{A}}+(2\beta_{% \mathcal{C}}+\alpha)(2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-\alpha)},\\ \left(1+\frac{\alpha}{2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}}\right)\lambda-1&\text{if }\frac{8% \alpha\beta_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}\mu_{\mathcal{A}}+4\beta_{\mathcal{C}}(2\beta_{% \mathcal{C}}-\alpha)}{8\alpha\beta_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}\mu_{\mathcal{A}}+(2\beta_% {\mathcal{C}}+\alpha)(2\beta_{\mathcal{C}}-\alpha)}<\lambda<2.\end{cases}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_prev end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 - As shown in Figure 2, our rates are generally closer to the tight rates than the prior rates are, except for narrow ranges of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ.

4 Averagedness of DYS

In this section, we present a novel averagedness result of the DYS operator that does not require cocoercivity of .

Theorem 4.1.

Let ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H be a real Hilbert space. Let :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbA}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H, :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbB}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H, and :ℋ⇉ℋ:absent⇉ℋℋ{\varbbC}\colon{\mathcal{H}}\rightrightarrows{\mathcal{H}}: caligraphic_H ⇉ caligraphic_H be monotone operators. If is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is L𝒞subscript𝐿𝒞L_{\mathcal{C}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz (so need not be cocoercive) with μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, L𝒞∈(0,∞)subscript𝐿𝒞0L_{\mathcal{C}}\in(0,\infty)italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ), and α∈(0,2⁢μ𝒜/L𝒞2)𝛼02subscript𝜇𝒜superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2\alpha\in(0,2\mu_{\mathcal{A}}/L_{\mathcal{C}}^{2})italic_α ∈ ( 0 , 2 italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then ,,,α,1 (so λ=1𝜆1\lambda=1italic_λ = 1) is 24−α⁢L𝒞2/μ𝒜24𝛼superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜\frac{2}{4-\alpha L_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}/\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG-averaged. Symmetrically, if is μℬsubscript𝜇ℬ\mu_{\mathcal{B}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is L𝒞subscript𝐿𝒞L_{\mathcal{C}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz with μℬ,L𝒞∈(0,∞)subscript𝜇ℬsubscript𝐿𝒞0\mu_{\mathcal{B}},L_{\mathcal{C}}\in(0,\infty)italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , ∞ ), and α∈(0,2⁢μℬ/L𝒞2)𝛼02subscript𝜇ℬsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2\alpha\in(0,2\mu_{\mathcal{B}}/L_{\mathcal{C}}^{2})italic_α ∈ ( 0 , 2 italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then ,,,α,1 is 24−α⁢L𝒞2/μℬ24𝛼superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2subscript𝜇ℬ\frac{2}{4-\alpha L_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}/\mu_{\mathcal{B}}}divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG-averaged.

Proof 4.2.

Consider the first statement, where is μ𝒜subscript𝜇𝒜\mu_{\mathcal{A}}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-strongly monotone and is L𝒞subscript𝐿𝒞L_{\mathcal{C}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz. Write 𝒜=ℳμ𝒜𝒜subscriptℳsubscript𝜇𝒜{\mathcal{A}}={\mathcal{M}}_{\mu_{\mathcal{A}}}caligraphic_A = caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ℬ=ℳℬℳ{\mathcal{B}}={\mathcal{M}}caligraphic_B = caligraphic_M, and 𝒞=ℳ∩ℒL𝒞𝒞ℳsubscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒞{\mathcal{C}}={\mathcal{M}}\cap{\mathcal{L}}_{L_{\mathcal{C}}}caligraphic_C = caligraphic_M ∩ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let θ=24−α⁢L𝒞2/μ𝒜𝜃24𝛼superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2subscript𝜇𝒜\theta=\frac{2}{4-\alpha L_{\mathcal{C}}^{2}/\mu_{{\mathcal{A}}}}italic_θ = divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 4 - italic_α italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Then the statement is equivalent to saying that 𝒢()𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,1⊆𝒢(𝒩θ){\mathcal{G}}({}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},\alpha,1})% \subseteq{\mathcal{G}}({\mathcal{N}}_{\theta})caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , 1 end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) ⊆ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

We now follow a similar argument in the proof of Theorem 3.3. Define

O=2−θ−1α,OL=0,{N,N′}=∂𝒢⁢(ℳ)∩∂𝒢⁢(ℒL𝒞),formulae-sequence𝑂2superscript𝜃1𝛼formulae-sequencesubscript𝑂𝐿0𝑁superscript𝑁′𝒢ℳ𝒢subscriptℒsubscript𝐿𝒞O=\frac{2-\theta^{-1}}{\alpha},\quad O_{L}=0,\quad\{N,N^{\prime}\}=\partial{% \mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{M}}\right)\cap\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal% {L}}_{L_{\mathcal{C}}}\right),italic_O = divide start_ARG 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 , { italic_N , italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } = ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_M ) ∩ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

and

𝒞′=α−1⁢((2−θ−1)+ℒR),superscript𝒞′superscript𝛼12superscript𝜃1subscriptℒ𝑅{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}=\alpha^{-1}((2-\theta^{-1}){\varbbI}+{\mathcal{L}}_{R}),caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

to have (2−θ−1)−α⁢𝒞′=ℒR2superscript𝜃1𝛼superscript𝒞′subscriptℒ𝑅(2-\theta^{-1}){\varbbI}-\alpha{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}={\mathcal{L}}_{R}( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_α caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfies an arc property and set R𝑅Ritalic_R to the minimum value that renders 𝒞⊂𝒞′𝒞superscript𝒞′{\mathcal{C}}\subset{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}caligraphic_C ⊂ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Note that 𝒢⁢(𝒞′)𝒢superscript𝒞′{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is centered at O𝑂Oitalic_O, which is on the right side of OLsubscript𝑂𝐿O_{L}italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT since 2−θ−1>02superscript𝜃102-\theta^{-1}>02 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0. Therefore, we have R=α⁢O⁢N¯=(2−θ−1)2+α2⁢L𝒞2𝑅𝛼¯𝑂𝑁superscript2superscript𝜃12superscript𝛼2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝒞2R=\alpha\overline{ON}=\sqrt{(2-\theta^{-1})^{2}+\alpha^{2}L_{{\mathcal{C}}}^{2}}italic_R = italic_α over¯ start_ARG italic_O italic_N end_ARG = square-root start_ARG ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG as depicted in the following figure.

Continuing on,

|𝒢()𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,1−(1−θ)|\displaystyle\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{% \mathcal{C}},\alpha,1}\right)-(1-\theta)\rvert| caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , 1 end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - ( 1 - italic_θ ) | ⊆|𝒢()𝒜,ℬ,𝒞′,α,1−(1−θ)|\displaystyle\subseteq\lvert{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}}% ,{\mathcal{C}}^{\prime},\alpha,1}\right)-(1-\theta)\rvert⊆ | caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_α , 1 end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) - ( 1 - italic_θ ) |

where the equality is a consequence of Theorem 2.1 with λ=1𝜆1\lambda=1italic_λ = 1 and s=1−θ𝑠1𝜃s=1-\thetaitalic_s = 1 - italic_θ. Now, it suffices to show supz∈𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞′,α,1DYS|z−(1−θ)|≤θsubscriptsupremum𝑧subscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬsuperscript𝒞′𝛼1𝑧1𝜃𝜃\sup_{z\in{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}% }^{\prime},\alpha,1}}\lvert z-(1-\theta)\rvert\leq\thetaroman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z ∈ caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_α , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z - ( 1 - italic_θ ) | ≤ italic_θ, or equivalently, by Lemma 1.1,

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,1)−(1−θ)|≤θsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼11𝜃𝜃\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,1)-(1-\theta)\rvert\leq\theta| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , 1 ) - ( 1 - italic_θ ) | ≤ italic_θ

for any zA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜z_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ), zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬ,z_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right),italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) , and zC′∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞′)subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝒢superscript𝒞′z_{C^{\prime}}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ).

With a similar argument as that for Theorem 3.1, we have
