where the first inequality follows from the triangle inequality and the second is from Lemma 3.4.

The second factor simplifies to

θ−1⁢|zB−θ|2+(2−θ−1)⁢|zB|2=2⁢|zB−12|2+θ−12=θsuperscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵𝜃22superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵22superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐵122𝜃12𝜃\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{B}-\theta\rvert^{2}+\left({2-\theta^{-1}}\right)\lvert z_% {B}\rvert^{2}=2\left|z_{B}-\frac{1}{2}\right|^{2}+\theta-\frac{1}{2}=\thetaitalic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_θ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG = italic_θ

since zB∈∂𝒢()α⁢ℬ=Circ(12,12)z_{B}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{B}}}\right)={\mathrm{% Circ}}\left(\frac{1}{2},\frac{1}{2}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_B end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ).

The first factor simplifies to

θ−1⁢|zA−θ|2+|2−θ−1−α⁢zC′|2⁢(2−θ−1)−1⁢|zA|2superscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴𝜃2superscript2superscript𝜃1𝛼subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′2superscript2superscript𝜃11superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2\displaystyle\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{A}-\theta\rvert^{2}+\lvert 2-\theta^{-1}-% \alpha z_{C^{\prime}}\rvert^{2}\left({2-\theta^{-1}}\right)^{-1}\lvert z_{A}% \rvert^{2}italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=(i)θ−1⁢|zA−θ|2+R2⁢(2−θ−1)−1⁢|zA|2superscript(i)absentsuperscript𝜃1superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴𝜃2superscript𝑅2superscript2superscript𝜃11superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴2\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(i)}}}{{=}}\theta^{-1}\lvert z_{A}-% \theta\rvert^{2}+R^{2}(2-\theta^{-1})^{-1}\lvert z_{A}\rvert^{2}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (i) end_ARG end_RELOP italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=(θ−1+R2⁢(2−θ−1)−1)⁢|zA−1θ−1+R2⁢(2−θ−1)−1|2+θ−1θ−1+R2⁢(2−θ−1)−1absentsuperscript𝜃1superscript𝑅2superscript2superscript𝜃11superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴1superscript𝜃1superscript𝑅2superscript2superscript𝜃112𝜃1superscript𝜃1superscript𝑅2superscript2superscript𝜃11\displaystyle=\left(\theta^{-1}+R^{2}(2-\theta^{-1})^{-1}\right)\left|z_{A}-% \frac{1}{\theta^{-1}+R^{2}(2-\theta^{-1})^{-1}}\right|^{2}+\theta-\frac{1}{% \theta^{-1}+R^{2}(2-\theta^{-1})^{-1}}= ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_θ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG
=(ii)2⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜)⁢|zA−12⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜)|2+θ−12⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜)superscript(ii)absent21𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜superscriptsubscript𝑧𝐴121𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜2𝜃121𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(ii)}}}{{=}}2(1+\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{% A}})\left|z_{A}-\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}})}\right|^{2}+\theta-\frac% {1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}})}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (ii) end_ARG end_RELOP 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_θ - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG
=(iii)θ,superscript(iii)absent𝜃\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{(iii)}}}{{=}}\theta,start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG (iii) end_ARG end_RELOP italic_θ ,

where we used zC′∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒞′)=Circ⁢(2−θ−1α,Rα)subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝒢superscript𝒞′Circ2superscript𝜃1𝛼𝑅𝛼z_{C^{\prime}}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({\mathcal{C}}^{\prime}\right)={% \mathrm{Circ}}\left(\frac{2-\theta^{-1}}{\alpha},\frac{R}{\alpha}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG ) in (i), θ−1+R2⁢(2−θ−1)−1=2⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜)superscript𝜃1superscript𝑅2superscript2superscript𝜃1121𝛼subscript𝜇𝒜\theta^{-1}+R^{2}(2-\theta^{-1})^{-1}=2(1+\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}})italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in (ii), and zA∈∂𝒢()α⁢𝒜=Circ(12⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜),12⁢(1+α⁢μ𝒜))z_{A}\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}\left({}_{\alpha{\mathcal{A}}}\right)={\mathrm{% Circ}}\left(\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{\mathcal{A}})},\frac{1}{2(1+\alpha\mu_{% \mathcal{A}})}\right)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT italic_α caligraphic_A end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_Circ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_α italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) in (iii). Thus, we conclude

|ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,1)−(1−θ)|2≤θ2.superscriptsubscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼11𝜃2superscript𝜃2\lvert\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,1)-(1-\theta)\rvert% ^{2}\leq\theta^{2}.| italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , 1 ) - ( 1 - italic_θ ) | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Since ζDYS⁢(zA,zB,zC′;α,λ)subscript𝜁DYSsubscript𝑧𝐴subscript𝑧𝐵subscript𝑧superscript𝐶′𝛼𝜆\zeta_{\text{DYS}}(z_{A},z_{B},z_{C^{\prime}};\alpha,\lambda)italic_ζ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_α , italic_λ ) is symmetric with respect to zAsubscript𝑧𝐴z_{A}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and zBsubscript𝑧𝐵z_{B}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the second statement follows from the same argument.

The averagedness coefficient of Theorem 4.1 is, in fact, tight in the sense that it cannot be reduced (improved) without further assumptions. This can be proved by showing that there is a z∈𝒵𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,1DYS𝑧subscriptsuperscript𝒵DYS𝒜ℬ𝒞𝛼1z\in{\mathcal{Z}}^{\text{DYS}}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{\mathcal{C}},% \alpha,1}italic_z ∈ caligraphic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DYS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that z≠1𝑧1z\neq 1italic_z ≠ 1 and z∈∂𝒢⁢(𝒩θ)𝑧𝒢subscript𝒩𝜃z\in\partial{\mathcal{G}}({\mathcal{N}}_{\theta})italic_z ∈ ∂ caligraphic_G ( caligraphic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). However, we omit this proof for the sake of conciseness.

5 Conclusion

In this work, we extended the SRG theory to accommodate the DYS operator and used this theory to analyze the convergence of DYS iterations. In our view, the SRG theory of Section 2 opens the door to many avenues of future work on splitting methods, and the analyses of Section 3 serve as demonstrations of such possibilities. One possible future direction is to further refine the analysis on the complex plane and obtain tighter contraction factors, as the contraction factors ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ presented in Section 3 are not tight in the sense that

ρ>sup∈𝒜,ℬ,𝒞,α,λx,y∈dom,x≠y∥x−y∥∥x−y∥.\rho>\sup_{\begin{subarray}{c}{\varbbT}\in{}_{{\mathcal{A}},{\mathcal{B}},{% \mathcal{C}},\alpha,\lambda}\\ x,y\in\mathrm{dom}\,{\varbbT},\,x\neq y\end{subarray}}\frac{\lVert{\varbbT}x-{% \varbbT}y\rVert}{\lVert x-y\rVert}.italic_ρ > roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL ∈ start_FLOATSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A , caligraphic_B , caligraphic_C , italic_α , italic_λ end_FLOATSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_x , italic_y ∈ roman_dom , italic_x ≠ italic_y end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_x - italic_y ∥ end_ARG .

Another direction is to characterize optimal or near-optimal choices of parameters α𝛼\alphaitalic_α and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ given a set of assumptions on the operators.

References

  • [1] F. J. Aragón-Artacho and D. Torregrosa-Belén, A direct proof of convergence of Davis–Yin splitting algorithm allowing larger stepsizes, Set-Valued and Variational Analysis, 30 (2022), pp. 1–19.
  • [2] H. H. Bauschke and P. L. Combettes, Convex Analysis and Monotone Operator Theory in Hilbert Spaces, Springer, 2nd ed., 2017.
  • [3] A. Beck and M. Teboulle, A fast iterative shrinkage-thresholding algorithm for linear inverse problems, SIAM journal on imaging sciences, 2 (2009), pp. 183–202.
  • [4] K. Bredies, E. Chenchene, D. A. Lorenz, and E. Naldi, Degenerate preconditioned proximal point algorithms, SIAM Journal on Optimization, 32 (2022), pp. 2376–2401.
  • [5] L. M. Briceno-Arias, Forward-Douglas–Rachford splitting and forward-partial inverse method for solving monotone inclusions, Optimization, 64 (2015), pp. 1239–1261.
  • [6] R. E. Bruck, On the weak convergence of an ergodic iteration for the solution of variational inequalities for monotone operators in Hilbert space, Journal of Mathematical Analysis and Applications, 61 (1977), pp. 159–164.
